physical_appearance: This is a handwritten calligraphy consisting of a prayer written on a piece of black sheet of paper. The title is printed at the top in reddish ink. The first and last line of the prayer is written in black ink. The rest of the prayer is written in reddish ink. There is a blue border around the prayer. The sheet of paper has several tears and holes in it, especially along the left, and top sides.
sgcool_label_text: This artefact is part of the archive of James Steele, Royal Artillery (Field) who served in Malaya from January 1941-February 1942, when interned as a P.O.W at Changi until his release in October 1945.
title_text: Prayer in hand-written calligraphy from P.O.W archive
subject_terms_1: world wars prisoners of war prayers (document genre)
subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Prisoners of war Calligraphy Prayers
context_7: Great Britain. Army. Royal Field Artillery
